meanings.definition: To perform or make something without preparation
meanings.sent1: She improvises a song during the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The comedian often improvises jokes during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: The chef improvises a new recipe using leftover ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The artist improvises with colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent5: He improvises a solution to fix the broken toy.

meanings.definition: To invent or make something up on the spot
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor improvises a funny line that wasn't in the script.
meanings.sent2: In storytelling, sometimes authors improvise plot twists to keep readers engaged.
meanings.sent3: The student improvises an excuse for not completing the homework.
meanings.sent4: The magician improvises a new trick to amaze the audience.
meanings.sent5: The explorer improvises a shelter using available materials in the wilderness.
